intro: Zosima heterodonta, commonly known as the heterodonta zosima, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Zosima heterodonta is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological roles in its habitat.
